result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Jo Plese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
0 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment for the first 6 months, second 6 months same release privileges PLUS release to Day Reporting Center/electronic monitoring.
Eligible for the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge AND costs and surcharges in Case 14CF4025. within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.

Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12
months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days
days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment for the first 6 months, second 6 months same release privileges PLUS release to Day Reporting Center/electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2
years with the following conditions:
*

**ELIGIBLE FOR DOSAGE PROBATION**  Card given.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge AND costs and surcharges in Case 14CF4025. within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Rebecca Jo Plese not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Rebecca Jo Plese not in court, in custody, not produced.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea hearing. For reasons presented to the court, Court does not object to case being transferred to Branch 26 for a global resolution. Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. Defense addresses the Court regarding lower pending case, 14CF4025. For the reasons placed on the record the case is adjourned for Plea Hearing on 4-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Court notes no objection to the lower pending case being transferred to Br. 17 or for this case being transferred to another Court for global resolution.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Rebecca Jo Plese not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. Case held off the record. Defendant not produced for the purposes of scheduling. 
Defense counsel is in a Jury Trial in another court. Case is adjourned for Plea Hearing on 4-3-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca Jo Plese not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance scheduled for this date 04-06-2015. Defendant is in custody. Both files sent to in-custody court.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
